page.title: 04Shopping:Lawshall & District
page.content: Within our area we have 2 shops half a mile apart. One is an C18, timberframed and plastered cottage which uses the front room as a tiny sub post office & general store. Cramming a wide range of assorted stock,including bread,pastries fresh vegetables,stationery,toiletries & wines & spirits, into the tiny space. This shop is a very important part of the village as it tends to be a meeting place,especially for the older folk on Thursday, when pensions are paid. As it is situated opposite the village school and church, it is considered the centre of the rather spreadout village. The second shop is a new mini Mace Super- market built on a small new housing development in the newer part of the village. This also offers a very wide range of goods and two extra services, dry cleaning & shoe repairs.
